messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:59): this app cache thing is going to make things SO confusing to people who list more than they should in their manigest
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:59): manifest
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:06): notes that #7 in DanC's list of things to do with RDFa is happening without RDFa and even without the author having to insert the data
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:09): can someone create GraphML? :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:10): (possibly as a delta spec on top of MathML)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:10): possibly start at version 5?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:10): e.g. http://www.cl.cam.ac.uk/~aac10/escience/sciborg.html
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:10): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: GraphML would be tough
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:11): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Use cases? I'm not quite sure what you want it for :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:15): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: graphing things like f(x) and f'(x) (for the same function). Just thinking about typing up all of my Higher Maths notes :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:16): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: and then things in physics like the relation between pressure and the multiplicative inverse of the volume
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:17): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: surely all you need to do is specify some method to link up some graphing software to MathML?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:19): What's wrong with existing solutions, like using gnuplot and outputting PNG or SVG?

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:22): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: surely any export to SVG of something like an exponential curve will rely on setting points, which will therefore lessen quality somewhat?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:22): Also, it's far easier to just scan hand-written notes rather than type them in :-p
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:23): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: but harder to read :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:23): has hellish handwriting
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:25): Just put error bars on the exponential-approximated-by-Beziers curve, since that'll be proper and physicsy
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:26): the more I think about doing it, the less easy it seems to do :P
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:26): (Actually, I'd guess gnuplot always approximates with straight lines, but the same concept applies)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:27): I got some homework for next Monday. I can't remember what.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:27): s/next/this/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:29): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: in fact, all of 1 through 5 are...

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:49): "Finally, though Ursula may not know what to make of the paul:audience predicate, she can quickly find out what this predicate means using typical RDF navigation." I have no idea what "typical RDF navigation" is...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:51): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: download some OWL?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:52): meta is like cowbell
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:52): no matter how much you have, you clearly need more

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:53): knows nothing about RDF except that most things using RDF seem to have been written under the assumption that everyone using it is exceptionally bright and into markup-based categorisation

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:59): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: If all you want is a function plotting language, content MathML might get you most of the way there. If you want to do data plots as well things get harder
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:05): hmm. these XML and JSON formats I have designed waste an insane propertion of bytes in repeated element, attribute and JSON object key names
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:06): proportion even
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:06): perhaps I should investigate gzip
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:07): Bencode
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:07): rather http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bencode
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:07): like a compact less readable json
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:08): Just pack all the data into a custom binary stream
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:08): 6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e: I take it that it doesn't have the off-the-shelf tool benefits nor the mindshare benefits of JSON
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:10): figuring out how to enable gzip filtering in Jetty seems more like something that software at the other end of the pipe might support
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:11): http://jetty.mortbay.org/xref/org/mortbay/jetty/servlet/DefaultServlet.html
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:11): "gzip             If set to true, ...."

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:11): converted a game engine to use XML instead of a custom binary format for its map files, which was alright until people started making maps with thousands of trees, at ~170 bytes of XML per tree vs ~20 bytes of binary data
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:11): wait, that's not an on-the-fly gzipper
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:13): ha! "Use Case #9 ‚Äî Publishing a RDF Vocabulary" - how does that qualify as a use case for RDF?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:13): huh, bencoding is quite nice
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:13): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: It's a use case for RDFa, not for RDF
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:14): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: it is nice, but doesn't have the popular tool support of json+gzip
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:14): which gets you pretty close in terms of space savings
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:14): 6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e: yeah but since it would take all of 10 lines in most languages to write a decoder...
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:14): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: writing the decoder isn't hard, it's getting people to install it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:14): 6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e: i like that it has bijection between values and encoded data
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:15): yeah, that's nice
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:15): though i can't find any definition anywhere of error handling for bencoded strings
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:15): we'll looked at it for an internal project at Technorati, but ended up going with json+gzip instead
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:15): there is no error handling, there is no spec
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:16): other than http://wiki.theory.org/BitTorrentSpecification
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:16): that's unfortunate
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:16): i'm looking for a format for the manifest of offline application caches
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:17): json seems like a good candidate
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:17): i don't want to use json or xml, both have way too many ways of going wrong and json doesn't define error handling
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:17): given that browsers tend to support i already
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:17): and json is really heavy weight (though not as much as xml)

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:18): i'm thinking of just having one uri per line, with # for comments, and maybe some annotation support of some kind to list the various other things we have to include
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:18): so is HTML, maybe we should make a binary version?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:18): html has defined error handling now
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:18): and yes, it's far too heavy weight for a manifest format
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:18): looks like my JSON serializer produces parseable JSON. yay
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:19): i didn't even consider using html :-)
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:19): points an obligatory finger at http://microformats.org/wiki/xoxo
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:21): What kind of structure does the manifest need?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (00:21): It seems like RDF(a) has hijacked all claims to sharing vocabularies

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:22): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: a list of URIs, a list of URI-prefix to URI mappings, another list of URIs distinguishable from the first, and user comments for documentation and so there is a way to force the file contents to change without changing their semantics.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:24): validator.nu now supports &out=json
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:24): (the spec on the wiki isn't up-to-date yet)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:24): callbacks aren't supported yet, either
